title: 114_hr3588
content: The "Guaranteed 3 Percent COLA for Seniors Act of 2015" establishes a Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers to track changes in expenditures typical for individuals aged 62 or older. The Bureau of Labor Statistics will publish this index monthly, with an effective date starting after July 31 of the enactment year. Appropriations are authorized for the implementation of this section. The amendment to Section 215(i) of the Social Security Act introduces the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and older receiving monthly insurance benefits. This index will be used for adjusting the primary insurance amount after the individual turns 62. The amendment to Section 215(i) of the Social Security Act introduces the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and older receiving monthly insurance benefits. Effective for adjustments to the primary insurance amount after age 62, the Commissioner will increase benefit amounts and primary insurance amounts as if the base quarter were a cost of living computation quarter with a minimum increase of 3 percent. The amendments made by this section are not considered a general benefit increase under the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this section will apply to determinations for base quarters ending on or after September 30 of the second calendar year following the enactment of this Act.
